Key Match Events: Antonín Barák was dismissed after being shown two yellow cards in the opening 20 minutes
Cenk Tosun scored the winning goal in the 94th minute of stoppage time
18 cards shown overall (16 yellows, 2 reds), the most in a single game in the tournament’s history
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey advanced to the knockout stages while the Czechs were eliminated
Antonín Barák became the first Czech Republic player to be sent off at the European Championship since Radoslav Latal vs the Netherlands at Euro 2000
His dismissal, timed at 19:28, was also the earliest sending off in the tournament’s history
Tomás Soucek scored the equalizer to set up a nervy finish in Hamburg
Turkey became the first team to receive eight yellow cards in a Euros match, eventually ending with 11 including subs
If they can channel that passion in a positive way, Turkey can look to at least match their semi-final appearance in 2008 as they find themselves in the so-called ‘easier’ side of the draw
